title: German Apple Cake Recipe
description: This German apple cake is an easy-to-make, moist, dense cake bursting with fresh apple and cinnamon flavor for a delicious fall treat.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Apple Cake Recipes German Apple Cake 4.8 (1,555) 1,277 Reviews 210 Photos This German apple cake makes a moist, dense cake that keeps well. It has been a family favorite for over 20 years. It's delicious served with a dusting of confectioners' sugar. Submitted by Barbara Updated on August 1, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 210 210 210 210 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 24 Yield: 1 (9x13-inch) cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 1 cup vegetable oil 2 large eggs 2 cups white sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 cups all-purpose flour 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon 1 teaspoon baking soda ¬Ω teaspoon salt 4 cups apples - peeled, cored and diced Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch cake pan. Beat oil and eggs in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until creamy. Add sugar and vanilla; beat well. Stir together flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt in a bowl. Slowly add flour mixture to egg mixture; mix until combined. The batter will be very thick. Fold in apples by hand using a wooden spoon. Spread batter into the prepared pan. Bake cake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool cake on a wire rack. kadek I Made It Print 2,556 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 201 Calories 10g Fat 28g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 24 Calories 201 % Daily Value * Total Fat 10g 12% Saturated Fat 1g 7% Cholesterol 16mg 5% Sodium 107mg 5% Total Carbohydrate 28g 10% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 19g Protein 2g 3% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 7mg 1% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 41mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of German Apple Cake 01 of 210 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Member 02 of 210 Photo by¬† tina 01/23/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Family favorite I had another apple cake recipe, but this one is better! Moist, and very tasty. Here are my tweaks: increased flour to 2 1/2 cups as others suggested; cut sugar to 1 1/2 cups; increased cinnamon to 1T; used only 1/2 cup oil and added 1/2 cup applesauce; baked this in a bundt pan and sugared it instead of flouring; baked it for about 65 minutes. Fantastic, and I'll make this again! 03 of 210 Photo by¬† WobblyTimer6231 12/31/2024 Family favorite I have already tried this recipe, and it turned out to be both delicious and easy. I made a small variation to the original recipe by adding the zest and juice of one lemon, as well as a handful of almonds for extra flavor. Highly recommended! 04 of 210 Photo by¬† Angie Lindsey 08/12/2024 Delish!!! I drizzle Carmel over the top. I also bake it in a 9‚Äù spring form pan!! 05 of 210 Photo by¬† LINDA 09/10/2023 Smells amazing. Can‚Äôt wait to try it. üòäüòä 06 of 210 Photo by¬† Yoly 08/24/2023 Absolutely delicious! Followed the recipe and did not change a thing. A scoop of vanilla ice cream would take this cake over the top. Thanks for the recipe. 07 of 210 Photo by¬† Paula 08/18/2023 Oh my! This is so good! It is bursting with apples on the inside and has a crunchy topping on the outside. 08 of 210 Photo by¬† Evan 07/31/2023 Great Recipe! 09 of 210 Photo by¬† Luc Orion 04/22/2023 Love this cake,I reduced sugar to 1 cup brown sugar and added 2 bananasUsing whole wheat instead of all purposeIt came out great! Like banana bread with apple pie in it. 10 of 210 Photo by¬† OrangeBoba6678 11/06/2022 Turned out great, but I did modify slightly. Macintosh apples are the gold standard. 1 1/2 cups of sugar instead of 2. 6-8 cups of Macintosh apples. You can‚Äôt go wrong with more apples if you can fold them into this very thick batter. It does take some elbow grease. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Jewish Apple Cake 229 Ratings Cranberry Pistachio Biscotti 1,872 Ratings Apple Bundt Cake 394 Ratings Apple Cake 284 Ratings Irish Apple Cake Irish Apple Cake Fresh Apple Walnut Cake 64 Ratings Applesauce Cake 363 Ratings Apple Spice Cake 314 Ratings Pumpkin Cake 1,021 Ratings French Apple Cake 99 Ratings Easy Pumpkin Cake 305 Ratings Passover Apple Cake 80 Ratings Easy Apple Charlotte 10 Ratings Pineapple Angel Food Cake 606 Ratings Apple Cinnamon Cake 517 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. name: Barbara
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch cake pan.;Beat oil and eggs in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer until creamy. Add sugar and vanilla; beat well.;Stir together flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt in a bowl. Slowly add flour mixture to egg mixture; mix until combined. The batter will be very thick. Fold in apples by hand using a wooden spoon. Spread batter into the prepared pan.;Bake cake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool cake on a wire rack. kadek
